result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt:
Defendant TRAVIS D. HOOVER in court.  Attorney Michael Lim in court for TRAVIS D. HOOVER.  Prosecuting attorney Anthony Prekop in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Compliant with victims rights.  Case is resolved, however, defendant is objecting to restitution.   Court removes JT and schedules pleas and restitution hearing.  Bond continues.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Restitution hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant TRAVIS D. HOOVER appeared by phone.  Attorney Michael Lim in court for TRAVIS D. HOOVER.  Prosecuting attorney Stephanie Ann Stauber Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Compliant with victims rights. Defendant was arranged to be transported from the jail for hearing, however, probation agent picked him up from the jail prior to hearing, and therefore, defendant appeared via phone from her office.   Court scheduled a PLEAS hearing prior to the scheduled JT.   Bond continues.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.

CC FRAUD. USE(PTAC), BAIL JUMP
CONDITIONS:   No contact with V1 in Oshkosh PD report # 22-20455.  No contact with KAIA EMERSON dob 3/30/1991 & KAYA KAVADAS dob 9/20/02.  Absolute sobriety.  No possession or consumption of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.  Defendant does acknowledge they've been advised who the victim(s) is/are.

Prosecuting attorney Amanda Lynn Folger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant TRAVIS D. HOOVER appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Lim in court for TRAVIS D. HOOVER.  DE requests to modify bond to sig bond. State does not object as long as it is for treatment. State requesting bond to remain as cash until bed is available. DE states that bed is available on 8/1/2022. DE states probation agent will transport him to the treatment facility. Court amends bond to sig bond upon opportunity DE is place at inpatient facility. Agent to notify court. Once DE leaves facility, bond reverts back to cash bond. DE is to appear in person at his next hearing.
